comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110809 Firefox/8.0a1
Build ID: 20110809030751

Steps to reproduce:

I wrote a few canvas test pages to gauge canvas drawing performance on a few browsers. I tested the following pages on Chromium 13, IE 10 Platform PReview, Firefox 5, and Firefox Nightly Builds August 9th 2011.

http://codebot.org/html5/blocks.htm
http://codebot.org/html5/text-flower.htm

Each test displays a simple graphical test that displays the frames drawn per second.

My test computer is a laptop running Microsoft Windows 7 64 bit with a T9500 CPU and an GeForce 8600GT GPU.


Actual results:

Chromium keeps up to about 55fps, IE10 manages around 35fps, and both Firefox 5 and Nightly Builds lag far behind at around 15fps.


Expected results:

I expect Firefox performance to be on par with Chromium 13 or at least IE 10.

comments.raw_text:
FWIW -- testing the "blocks" demo on my Linux machine, Chromium ranges between 30 - 40 fps.   Firefox Nightly ranges 15-25 fps.   (Using a fresh profile)

Not as pronounced as what Anthony's seeing on Windows, but still a good deal behind.

Chromium	13.0.782.112 (Developer Build 95650) Ubuntu 11.04

comments.text: (It looks like the demo uses "requestAnimationFrame" for scheduling, so this isn't a setTimeout-related issue.)
comments.raw_text: (It looks like the demo uses "requestAnimationFrame" for scheduling, so this isn't a setTimeout-related issue.)
comments.author: dholbert@mozilla.com
comments.creator: dholbert@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text:
OK, so looking at the blocks demo, we're more or less gated on fillRect (it's 60% of the time).

On the text-flower demo, all the time is under gfxTextRun::Draw.

So in fact those two demos show completely different issues; worth filing separate bugs on them.

The fillRect thing will presumably get better with Azure.

The text drawing is an issue for general text drawing, not just canvas, I would think.
comments.text:
OK, so looking at the blocks demo, we're more or less gated on fillRect (it's 60% of the time).

On the text-flower demo, all the time is under gfxTextRun::Draw.

So in fact those two demos show completely different issues; worth filing separate bugs on them.

The fillRect thing will presumably get better with Azure.

The text drawing is an issue for general text drawing, not just canvas, I would think.
